item.title: Perfiles de suelos en R (aqp)
item.description: Por: Victor Sevilla. library(aqp) ## This is aqp 1.17 ## ## Attaching package: 'aqp' ## The following object is masked from 'package:base': ## ## union data() data("sp1") View(sp1) head(sp1) ## group id top bottom bound_distinct bound_topography name texture prop ## 1 2 P001 0 2 A S A1 GRVLS 13 ## 2 2 P001 2 14 G S A2 GRVLS 7 ## 3 2 P001 14 49 G S AB GRVLS 9 ## 4 2 P001 49 57 C S BA GRVLS 14 ## 5 2 P001 57 89 C S Bt GRVSCL 21 ## 6 2 P001 89 89 <NA> <NA> Rt <NA> NA ## structure_grade structure_size structure_type stickiness plasticity ## 1 1 F PL <NA> <NA> ## 2 1 M SBK <NA> <NA> ## 3 1 M SBK <NA> <NA> ## 4 1 CO SBK <NA> <NA> ## 5 2 CO SBK <NA> <NA> ## 6 NA <NA> <NA> <NA> <NA> ## field_ph hue value chroma ## 1 7.

item.title: Triangulo de texturas del suelo
item.description: Por: Victor Sevilla. #install.packages(pkgs = "soiltexture") library(soiltexture) TT.plot( class.sys = "USDA-NCSS.TT", lang = "es2", main = "Triangulo de Textura de Suelo", lwd.axis = 0.5, cex.lab = 0.8, cex.axis = 0.8) TT.plot( class.sys = "USDA.TT", class.p.bg.col = c("aquamarine", "aquamarine2", "aquamarine3", "cornsilk", "burlywood1", "burlywood3", "darkseagreen1", "darkseagreen3", "darkolivegreen1", "darkolivegreen2", "deepskyblue", "deepskyblue4"), lang = "es2", lwd.axis = 0.5, cex.lab = 0.8, cex.axis = 0.8) TT.classes.tbl (class.sys = "USDA.TT") [ ,1:2] ## abbr name ## [1,] "Cl" "clay" ## [2,] "SiCl" "silty clay" ## [3,] "SaCl" "sandy clay" ## [4,] "ClLo" "clay loam" ## [5,] "SiClLo" "silty clay loam" ## [6,] "SaClLo" "sandy clay loam" ## [7,] "Lo" "loam" ## [8,] "SiLo" "silty loam" ## [9,] "SaLo" "sandy loam" ## [10,] "Si" "silt" ## [11,] "LoSa" "loamy sand" ## [12,] "Sa" "sand" data()

item.title: Trabajando con capas shape y raster (SIG) en R
item.description: Por: Victor Sevilla Objetivos: Mostrar una manera de trabajar objetos espaciales del tipo vectorial (Shape) y raster (tiff) en R para realizar estudios agroambientales. Si conocen otra forma de hacerlo seria un gusto para nosotros recibir su valioso aporte y, así colaborar con nuestra comunidad. Materiales y metodos: -Emplearemos aplicaciones como R, RStudio y QGis. -Datos de la cuenca hidrográfica del río Canoabo en Venezuela, tales como partes de agua, modelos digital de elevación, sitios de muestreos de suelos entre otros.

item.title: A Plain Markdown Post
item.description: This is a post written in plain Markdown (*.md) instead of R Markdown (*.Rmd). The major differences are: You cannot run any R code in a plain Markdown document, whereas in an R Markdown document, you can embed R code chunks (```{r}); A plain Markdown post is rendered through Blackfriday, and an R Markdown document is compiled by rmarkdown and Pandoc. There are many differences in syntax between Blackfriday’s Markdown and Pandoc’s Markdown.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.: 26.00 ## Median :15.0 Median : 36.00 ## Mean :15.4 Mean : 42.98 ## 3rd Qu.
